topic.title: Customize Which Components are Expanded and Collapsed

section.title: Overview
section.p: The WebHelp Responsive system does not use the default Bootstrap implementation for the expand/collapse feature. Instead, it uses a custom implementation that targets components that match a certain pattern (in most cases, components that have a title). The title always remains visible regardless of whether the rest of the component is collapsed or expanded. The expand () or collapse () widget is displayed to the left of the title and clicking this widget toggles the expand/collapse state for the particular node.

The patterns that the WebHelp Responsive system identifies as components that can be expanded/collapsed are:
Nested topics that include a title
Sections that include a title
Tables that include a title
Index term groups (in this case, the first letter of the index term becomes the title)

A component that can be expanded/collapsed should have the following abstract form (where the title element and the subcomponent elements are siblings and they are the first level children of the component element):[component] [title/] [subcomponent_1/] [subcomponent_2/] ................................. [subcomponent_N/] [/component]
